text:
TELEVISION 15/FM RADIO 89.5
July 3, 1968
Mr. Kenneth R. Clark
Project Director; Programs for the Disadvantaged
Educational Television Stations
1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington, D. C. 20036
Dear Ken;
Congratulations on your appointment! I hope we can develop a good_
library of exchangeable programs.
I do not currently have any ghetto-prog ram s^ in our library that would
be usable beyond the San Diego community. We have done a few proÂ¬
grams relating to and involving members of that community, but they
were all timely and local. We are developing several programs that
will get us deeply involved in ghetto programing and that should relate
to both the black and Mexican^American populations. While it is too
soon to say whether or not they would be useful beyond San Diego, I
should state that our emphasis at the moment will be on local programs
related to local happenings. What would actually develop? remains to
be seen.
We will, as you suggest, take the initiative and inform you of anything
ydiich might be useful beyond our own environs._
Bradford B. Warner
Program Director
KEBS-TV
SAN DIEGO STATE COLLEGE. SAN DIEGO, CALIFORNIA, 92115 * 714/286-6415
